title: PokéSearch
summary: Quick Vue.js blitz using PokéAPI data.

title: Tomelist
summary: Simple UI for tracking FFXIV Moogle Tomestone events, built with React + TS + Theme UI.

title: Metasift
summary: Open Access MET Collection simple visual search UI, built with React + Material UI.

title: Beer Patrol
summary: A quick, SPA table app proof-of-concept.

title: Morse Alphabet
summary: An attempt at a d3-based connect-the-dots solver, built on Yeoman+AngularJS and hosted on Github Pages.

title: Oculi Crafter
summary: Simple application mimicking crafting from Child of Light (PS3, Ubisoft), built on Ember.js using ember-cli and hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: Smoke Signal
summary: A simple list that attempts to list the server status of various HL7 FHIR servers using Jekyll, JS, and GitHub Pages.

title: Symphony Daily Devotions App
summary: Stream devotional recordings on Android with ultimate flexibility via GitHub-backed data store.

title: Algorithmic Odyssey
summary: Top-down, turn-based strategy game with random map generation and fully customizable character development, built with Java using Slick2D with custom graphics.

title: KocoonTech LLC, Prototyping Sensor Mote
summary: Wireless, multi-sensor integration (humidity, temperature, heart-rate, orientation) on Libelium’s Waspmote hardware, with real-time communication to companion desktop NetBeans UI.

title: "Pwning" Netgear WNDR Routers
summary: A project for BU EC521 Cybersecurity, where we reproduced a BlackHat talk on hacking a Netgear small office/home office router.

title: Multicycle CPU Design
summary: A project for BU EC413 Computer Organization, where I designed and implemented a Multicycle CPU in Verilog.

title: MSP430 "Lighthouse"
summary: A project for BU EC450 Microprocessors, where we created a custom laboratory barcode scanner using a CD-ROM drive bay, a laser pointer, and an MSP430.

title: Custom FPGA Microprocessor
summary: A project for BU EC311 Logic Design, where we designed and implemented a custom single-cycle CPU in Verilog and an instruction set with a C compiler.

title: ImageRecognizer App
summary: A project for BU EC327 Software Engineering, where we designed an Android application to save images, tag them, and recognize them in future images.
